title: How to Make Orange and Mango Juice

steps.headline: Roll the orange against a counter or squeeze them tightly to loosen them up.
Cut the orange in half, make sure you remove the seeds.
Juice the orange, press and twist into the juicer to get all the juice out.
Scoop pulp out of the orange and add to juice, or if you prefer pulp less you can strain it.
steps.description: Add some extra flavour with a pinch or sugar.

steps.headline: Put in the fridge, juice is best served cold!
Gather some nice, ripe mangoes.
steps.description: They are best when they're in season. Try to get the same variety.

steps.headline: Wash the mangoes, they often have sap on the skin.
Gather your equipment, multiple bowls and spoons are needed so make sure you're prepared.
Peel the skin off the mangoes and add to the bowl.
steps.description: One bowl should be for the peel and one is for the pulp.

steps.headline: Press the pulp with your hand to separate the pulp from the juice.
Add 1/2 a cup of water to the bowl to liquefy the pulp.
steps.description: Add sugar to taste, keep trying the juice to test if the sugar is dissolved.

steps.headline: Strain the juice to get rid of the pulp, no one likes a good pulping
Put into a container and add place into the fridge, Juice is best served cold!
Remove the orange juice and the mango juice from the fridge so it is chilled and ready to drink.
Mix the juices.
steps.description: The juices should be mixed with a ratio of 1:1, for example 500 mls of orange juice should be mixed with 500 milliliters (16.9  fl oz) of mango juice to make 1 L of juice.

steps.headline: Serve your freshly squeezed juice and enjoy.

text: Juicing the Orange Roll the orange against a counter or squeeze them tightly to loosen them up.  Cut the orange in half, make sure you remove the seeds. Navel oranges don't have seeds. Juice the orange, press and twist into the juicer to get all the juice out.  Scoop pulp out of the orange and add to juice, or if you prefer pulp less you can strain it. Add some extra flavour with a pinch or sugar. Put in the fridge, juice is best served cold!  Juicing the Mango Gather some nice, ripe mangoes. They are best when they're in season. Try to get the same variety. Wash the mangoes, they often have sap on the skin.  Gather your equipment, multiple bowls and spoons are needed so make sure you're prepared.  Peel the skin off the mangoes and add to the bowl. One bowl should be for the peel and one is for the pulp. Press the pulp with your hand to separate the pulp from the juice.  Add 1/2 a cup of water to the bowl to liquefy the pulp. Add sugar to taste, keep trying the juice to test if the sugar is dissolved. Strain the juice to get rid of the pulp, no one likes a good pulping  Put into a container and add place into the fridge, Juice is best served cold!  Mixing the Two Remove the orange juice and the mango juice from the fridge so it is chilled and ready to drink.  Mix the juices. The juices should be mixed with a ratio of 1:1, for example 500 mls of orange juice should be mixed with 500 milliliters (16.9  fl oz) of mango juice to make 1 L of juice. Serve your freshly squeezed juice and enjoy.  Finished.
